top_comment.author: videowilliams

comments.text:
+RadioFreeEuropeInExile. The rest sounds good! I mean well done- that's 
well thought through. (The Brits are nothing if not good organisers, as 
history has shown.) Well, I had better have a think about how I'd put my 
life in storage back here for some time... but I sure do wanna see Europe 
again, and it looks like that's a window. Good stuff, bro!

Right this moment, I actually have to hit the road (or more accurately the 
train) to head to Sydney. I'm taking part in the "Reclaim Australia" Rally 
against creeping Islamisation there in a few hours. It's happening in 
cities and towns all over the country, but since Sydney had the terrorist 
attack at the Lindt Cafe I reckon that'll be the biggest.

We'll continue this from there!
comments.author: videowilliams

comments.text:
+videowilliams
I am a multi tasker.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
Sorry David i am just trying to plan ahead. I dont mean to overwhelm you. 
And yea that was a bit to much info.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
Whoa, so much information up there, +RadioFreeEuropeInExile.! Gimme a 
minute with all this... I can start with the fact that we drive on the left 
here, same as Her Majesty and yourself in the UK, but I have driven on the 
right too when I lived in the USA.
comments.author: videowilliams

comments.text:
+videowilliams
What side of the road do you drive on in Oz?
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
Say it would take 80 hours at 12 quid per hour  it would work out to about 
900 pounds sterling. I dont know what that is in Oz Dollars. I think you 
will be Ok since you have a room and board. Actually 9060 pounds. That way 
i dont have to pay you anything. Except for room and board. And i did add 
booze and Tobacco. What do you think?
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
Ok sorry there is a layover LOL. New Deli.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
I dont know how to share private. On G plus.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
I have Melbourne to Gatwick or Heathrow Airport. leaving the 13th  of may 
return open ended. 738 Euro. No lay over.  34 hour flight. Air India. 
Layover in New Deli for 12 hours. It will be a rough ride. But it is a 787 
dream liner.  All food and drinks included.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
I can figure the Airfare out if you can pay me back for it when you get 
paid by the Hotel. I talked to Trey Clarke who is my current GM and he said 
its OK. I will have to get your Cheque  made out to me so i can pay you 
cash. If that makes you nervous i understand totally. The only other way 
would be if you got a work Visa. It would be worth it if you want to stay 
and work longer. I could get you the Holiday Inn Express up by the Wal 
Mart  on M6. You can use my car. I wont be able to drive it anyway. I will 
barely be able to move for two weeks. I could get you two months work. I 
tried to get my Sister to help but she is  pissed at me. She has to work up 
in Lancashire. My step Daughter will help but every time she comes to 
London she want to go clubbing. I dont care but i would prefer somebody 
else drives her. The last thing i need is for her to Wreck my sisters car. 
She is very pretty and she gets drunk a bit. I would always drive them to 
the club then pick them up. I dont care what time it is. But after the 
ankle chop, i wont be able to for a while. Sarah will cook and clean the 
house, but i can just write her off on weekends. I remember what it was 
like to be young....Well sort of LOL. Sorry about the long text. I am 
trying to figure out how to do this thing.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
dont sell your car David, I will figure it out.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
+videowilliams
Ok i hope you can make the trip. Please let me know. I know it is not much 
but i really need the help.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
Oh that's a wonderful offer, +RadioFreeEuropeInExile. Truly! A bit of work, 
a bit of travel, a bit of financial assistance in Europe which I'm longing 
to visit anyway- sounds perfect! (I still don't know why you won't share 
these ideas privately >_>)

Painting is not beneath my dignity at all. I've done it before ;) And yeah, 
I'd love to see your London, including West London where you say they sound 
like me :) (Is that the nicer side of town? I notice Jeremy Clarkson & 
James May live there, for instance.) And yeah, I'lll help you gimp around. 
That doesn't bug me.

Short story is, though, that unless I take a loan from someone or 
something, I will have to sell my car to make a trip like this. Perhaps 
it's time... I do have offers from India and the USA too and would love to 
string them together into one trip around the world.... but I can't come 
empty-pocketed to all that. Then I get back to no car and I know 
not-quite-what for income at the end of it... that's the stuff I'm weighing 
up. But there's nothing I'm doing here that I can't leave...
comments.author: videowilliams

comments.text:
You can literally come with little money. I am just worried about you 
losing wages. I can talk to my boss and see if the Hotel could give you 
some work. The London Hotel needs all the doors and door frames re painted. 
Nobody did it last year. If you wouldn't mind i could get you 12 pounds an 
hour. It would be about 2 weeks if you would want to do it. You could have 
the Spanish kid to help. Or i could get a flat rate per door. That is what 
i did i made more money but i had to work really fast. got the kid to sand 
them and i just went over them with a brush and mini roller. It is not oil 
based paint so it is fairly easy work. Don't take it the wrong way i dont 
mean to insult you with such  a menial job. But my company is very fair. I 
could find you other work if you dont like that one. But the other stuff is 
landscaping. I was just thinking it would subsidize your airfare, I hope 
you dont get mad at me for suggesting this.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

comments.text:
Hey David do you plan on coming to London still? I am joking about you 
being my servant. Except for  driving me about. It really wont cost me much 
to have you stay for a while. But can you get off work for a few weeks. I 
can give you a place to stay and transport and feed you. Nobody is at the 
house. My step daughter may come help me out for two weeks but she lost her 
DL. so she cant drive  me. I was thinking about taking a road trip up to 
the Nordic lands. I can get free hotel rooms at the Holiday Inns. I also 
get that 50% off restaurant food and drink. The only expense for you is 
Airfare. I can throw in your booze and tobacco, but i cant really pay you 
much.
comments.author: RadioFreeEuropeInExile.

top_comment.author: Modestas Malakauskas

comments.text:
That doesn't change the fact that it's wrong.  People have been misusing it 
this way for, what, five years?  Six?  That doesn't mean the language is 
evolving.  That means some people don't know how that word works.
comments.author: trumpeterjen

comments.text:
+RAY NL Although that is how a lot of the language (meaning and spelling) 
we use now evolved. Trace back many words and their meaning transformed 
from erroneous use.
comments.author: Wyatt Nite

comments.text:
+Ryan Dunnigan
No. Just because a lot of people use a word wrongly doesn't mean the word 
lost it's meaning. If a lot of people start calling trees cars doesn't mean 
the word car is now the correct word to use call a tree.
comments.author: RAY NL

comments.text:
I'd be more tolerant of the change if we didn't already have a word that 
fits perfectly.
comments.author: trumpeterjen

comments.text:
+trumpeterjen
Well, he is partially correct. Languages do adapt and change over time, and 
how we speak now would be atrocious to, say, 200 years ago, or possibly 
even 100; however, the language does not change as quickly as he claims it 
does, and most likely the miss-use of literally is temporary.
comments.author: Pastaf Codier

comments.text:
+Ryan Dunnigan Just because people use it that way doesn't mean it's right. 
We have a perfectly good word--namely "figuratively"--that already fits 
that definition. It's the same way with the not-word "irregardless."Common 
=/= correct.
comments.author: trumpeterjen

comments.text:
+Pastaf Codier Quite the opposite actually, literally no longer means the 
same thing it once did. Because of the large number of people who now use 
the word differently the word "literally" is able to have a hyperbolic 
effect and actually mean something entirely new through the shift in how 
society views the word.
comments.author: Ryan Dunnigan

comments.text:
+RAY NL He is using it to create a hyperbolic effect, which is a common 
adaption of the word literally in recent history. Does it truly mean the 
same thing that it used to? Or has the meaning of the word changed through 
the consistent use of another meaning?
comments.author: Ryan Dunnigan

comments.text: +Modestas Malakauskas You are literally using the word literally wrongly...
comments.author: RAY NL

comments.text: +Modestas Malakauskas I believe you mean figuratively.
comments.author: Pastaf Codier

it acts as a waste and nutrient exchange

Lacking the protection of a placenta

the kangaroo baby emerges after only seven weeks in the

upwards.
just the opposite of us. Really, who does that to a chicken??
the Wombat is another marsupial - (laughs) - are you trying to hide??
-it's effective. Unlike the kangaroo
it has a rear-facing pouch. This is because the wombat
digs and lives in burrows. Here we see
2 wombats, both good at digging but one is clearly an idiot.
On the plus side if you're a baby, a rear-facing pouch prevents you from

Really. The marsupials penis - (sighs) - we always do this - why

It's like reviewing and opera - and, i don't know, talking about Wagner's penis
No, I don't want research to google that, Jerry.
Fine. Most marsupials have two prong penises
and the female has between two and three vaginas. Which sounds like a math problem
But we have one to one and it's not like it's
not complicated so now you know. The Koala is perhaps the cutest the mall the
marsupials
but it appears to have received the short end of the evolutionary (bleep)
Jerry, don't bleep it like that- it sounds like I said (sighs) -  don't even have to bleep
(bleep). The Koala lives mainly in the eucalyptus tree
and almost exclusively eats the eucalyptus leaf.
The eucalyptus leaf on the other hand has made it clear that it doesn't wanna
be eaten by anyone.
Aside from having very little nutritional value,
It is poisonous, and very hard to chew and digest.
To deal with this, the Koala has evolved a very long hind gut
which ferments leaves, sometimes for over 100 hours
a remarkable and complex adaptation that the Koala could've avoided by eating
pretty much
any other f*cking thing. Baby Koala's don't have the fully developed
piping to do this hind-gut fermentation
so instead they eat their mothers Freckle-pop - what is that - a little popsicle?
two words - fecal pap - oh - oh that's gross
fecal pap is a pre-digested greenish goo
like you know how a Cow regurgitates cud?
Well it's like that, except out of your ass.
-and you feed it to your child. The diets of most
herbivore marsupials pose another challenge - the coarse grasses and leaves
wear down there
teeth. Each has evolved a unique strategy to deal with this
the kangaroo has four sets of molars which moved forward as the front pairs
wear down
wombats have ruthless teeth that never stop growing
the koalas unique strategy is to have neither of these
so when its teeth wear down, it just starves to death.
Not only that, but the koala has the smallest brain-to-body mass ratio
of all the mammals.
And it has a smooth brain, which means that it hasn't evolved
the thinky-thinky parts. For example, if you pick eucalyptus leaves
which it eats, off the branch, and put them on a plate
the Koala doesn't know what to do with them. Not a genius animal
however this lack of brain gives the Koala a discrete
evolutionary advantage in that it does not give a f*ck
case in point - koala in the rain.
no f*cks given. None. Just remember
